title: The point of off season (ranked)?
body:
Hello Everyone :)

Just wondering what the point is of having ranked queues in between the end of a season and the start of the next season?

I finished S4 at silver 2..

By Christmas I had won another 65ish out of 100 games and was in Plat 5. (teemo top ftw)

Went 3-7 in provisionals and got demoted to Silver 3..

So what was the point of the in between time, as I am worse off than I was before winning all those games?

If anyone knows I would love to know :)

Thanks,

G

replies.body: How did you go from S2 to P5 in only a few months while playing 100 matches and only winning 65 of them?

Mainly to practice in a competitive environment to prepare for the next season. They do influence MMR (pretty much a negligible amount, especially with the  season reset). 
It also shows you that you are capable of great things such as: winning nobel prizes, conquering mountains and climbing the steps of the OCE ranked ladder (not really the first two...).

Sorry should have written about 65% (dont have exact numbers of games played etc) 

I was getting significant lp for the wins (20-30) and losing less for the losses (12-18ish) so I was able to pass through very fast.

That and I didnt get trolled in my promos for once? :)

Was all for nothing though which is a shame.

http://www.lolking.net/summoner/oce/433614

Check out my lolking graph to learn exactly how little it meant :)
